meanings.definition: relating to or using a dry copying process in which black or colored powder adheres to parts of a surface remaining electrically charged
meanings.sent1: The xerographic machine quickly produced a duplicate of the document.
meanings.sent2: The office used xerographic technology to make copies of important papers.
meanings.sent3: The xerographic printer decided to take a break and refused to copy any more pages.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a xerographic image, capturing every detail with precision.
meanings.sent5: The xerographic process left a distinct mark on the paper, making it easy to identify.
